Git.name: Git Workshop
Git.description:
Get an overview of Git and GitHub including what they are, their purpose, how they work, how they interact with each other, and much more.

You will learn about essential Git commands and concepts and go through several short demos using them.

Additionally, you will learn how to collaborate with others on a project using Git and GitHub, and learn how to contribute to open-source projects.

All of this combined will allow students to learn an essential skill that will follow them through their career in tech!

Git.name: Git Workshop
Git.description:
Have you been struggling to start contributing to our Open Source Initiative projects? Do you just need a refresher for CSC207?

No matter if you're from UTM, UTSG, or even high school, git a head start by attending our workshop, entirely online! üêô

You'll be even more ready to win prizes (maybe from even GitHub üëÄ) by contributing to our open source projects üëÄüëÄüëÄüëÄ

We've be covering the basics of how git works, so that you'll be set up for contribution in no time.

Frontend.name: CSSC √ó GDSC: Frontend Workshop
Frontend.description: We have teamed up with CSSC to bring you a workshop to get familiar with React AND UI/UX design!

Frontend.name: UX/UI Workshop
Frontend.description: Unlock the power of design thinking to create meaningful connections between people and products.

Frontend.name: CSSC x GDSC: Frontend Workshop
Frontend.description: Are you looking to break into the world of frontend web development but don't know where to start? Look no further!

Backend.name: Backend Development with AWS & Flask
Backend.description: Learn about backend development through using Flask, a Python web framework, and Amazon Web Services (AWS), the leading cloud service provider in the world!

Backend.name: CSSC √ó GDSC: Backend Workshop
Backend.description: Learn how to utilize Express.js, a back end web application framework useful for Node.js

Backend.name: CSSC √ó GDSC: Backend Workshop
Backend.description: Get hands-on experience üòã and learn how to create fast, secure, and scalable backend systems that drive your websites and applications.

Database and DevOps.name: DevOps Workshop Part 1
Database and DevOps.description: Learn all about DevOps, and get the chance to set up automated deployment and testing of your applications using GitHub Actions and Firebase!

Database and DevOps.name: Docker Workshop
Database and DevOps.description: Learn all about Docker and how to containerize your applications!

Database and DevOps.name: Database Workshop
Database and DevOps.description: Learn how to use MongoDB, a NoSQL database, to store and retrieve data in your applications!

Database and DevOps.name: DevOps Workshop
Database and DevOps.description: Learn how to use Docker and Github Actions to deploy your applications!

Machine Learning.name: Machine Learning and AI - with GDE Tanmay Bakshi
Machine Learning.description:
Google Developer Experts - Speaker Series:

Tanmay Bakshi is a LinkedIn Top 25 Tech Influencer, a bestselling author, a TED & Keynote Speaker, GDE, IBM Advisory Software Engineer and more - all at 18 years old. Join our talk to hear more about Tanmay's journey and accomplishments in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, highlighting some of his most recent projects and insightful advice - and ask him some questions of your own!

Machine Learning.name: Machine Learning Workshop 1
Machine Learning.description: First of a series of machine learning workshops. Introduction to basic machine learning concepts and a non-math approach to Machine Learning. Build your first machine model using a Kaggle dataset!  We will be covering basic concepts such as decision trees/forests, overfitting/underfitting, building the intuition behind how gradients are used for learning algorithms and hyper parameter tuning to help your model hit that sweet spot.  We will be using guided Kaggle labs for the workshop and help you move closer to getting your first Kaggle certification! All you need is some basic python knowledge and a laptop.

Machine Learning.name: Playing God: controlling the perception of AI
Machine Learning.description: The workshop will include an explanation of feature engineering topics, in a manner in which people with low technical skills can understand (as much as possible). This will be accompanied by the Mutual Information, PCA and Target Encoding labs.

Machine Learning.name: Computer Vision: See How Computers See
Machine Learning.description: This workshop will include learning about convolutional neural networks and taking a look at neuron activations to understand the feature extraction process during a simple image classification task. We will build our own convnets on Kaggle to continue our machine learning certification!

Cybersecurity.name: U of T CTF Competition
Cybersecurity.description:
Slides from Alex's talk at the CTF.

Join us in-person or online for our multi-club CTF (Capture-The-Flag) competition, taking place this January 14th and 15th. All beginner, intermediate, and skilled U of T students are welcome to participate in our security-oriented challenges and talks!

Cybersecurity.name: Web Scraping
Cybersecurity.description: Learn how to use Python requests, data structures, and BS4 to parse through HTML and find+manage info!

Cybersecurity.name: MCSS √ó GDSC: Intro to Cybersecurity Workshop
Cybersecurity.description: In this workshop, we will be covering a broad overview of cybersecurity with a hands-on web app challenge for you to get some experience with web vulnerabilities; particularly, OS command injection. This workshop will be beginner-friendly, although if you have JavaScript experience you will better understand some of the code that we present.

Cybersecurity.name: OWASP Juice Shop Workshop
Cybersecurity.description: In this workshop, we will be covering a greater variety of web application vulnerabilities through Juice Shop in the form of a tutorial. In order to develop a deeper understanding of how these vulnerabilities are introduced into the web application, we will also be taking a look under the hood into the source code of the Juice Shop website.

Cybersecurity.name: Reverse Engineering 101
Cybersecurity.description: Learn the fundamental tools and skills to take a look under the hood of your favourite programs; we'll be covering compilers, assembly language, and software used to disassemble and analyze executables.

Cybersecurity.name: 2023 DeerHacks CTF (solutions)
Cybersecurity.description: Join the DeerHacks CTF and solve cybersecurity puzzles with the opportunity to win a Google Home Mini! Are you ready to test your skills as a computer whiz?

Miscellaneous.name: Game Development Workshop
Miscellaneous.description: In this beginner-friendly workshop, we will go through what Unity is, some fundaments about C# for game development, and how do we use the two to create interactive games.

Miscellaneous.name: Make your own Discord Bot
Miscellaneous.description: Learn how to code your own Discord bot, and learn about the Discord.js API. Learn how to make buttons, dropdown selections, add commands and event listeners, and even make a Discord game!

Miscellaneous.name: C Workshop
Miscellaneous.description: Learn C concepts such as: structs, typedefs and pointers, manual memory management, stack and heap!

Miscellaneous.name: Origami Workshop
Miscellaneous.description: Origami is a proven tool to help reduce stress and anxiety levels, by engaging the mind in a calming and meditative activity. Folding intricate paper designs can also help improve focus and concentration, allowing you to feel more present and mindful in the moment. Not only will you leave feeling accomplished and relaxed, but you'll also have the opportunity to make new friends and connect with others who share a passion for creativity and mindfulness.
